column1: #Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to view your computer 's hardware and software specifications .
#Text=It 's the apple-shaped icon in the top-left corner of your Mac 's screen .
#Text=This option is near the top of the drop-down menu .
#Text=There are several tabs at the top of the " About This Mac " window that you can use to view different type of information :

column1: #Text=- View your Mac 's operating system , processor , and memory information here .
#Text=- View information about your Mac 's screen and any attached displays .
#Text=- View your Mac 's storage allocation , including how much space files are taking up and how much space remains .
#Text=- View a list of resources to help solve any potential problems .
#Text=- View your Mac 's service history ( e. g. , warranty information ) .
#Text=It 's in the bottom-left corner of the screen ; doing so will open the Start menu , which has a built-in search feature .
#Text=It 's in the bottom-left corner of the screen .
#Text=Doing so will open the System Information window .
#Text=There are four tabs listed in the top-left corner of the window :
#Text=This is the default tab to which System Information opens ; it contains details about your computer 's operating system , installed memory , and processor type .
#Text=- View a list of all hardware drivers and information associated with devices ( e. g. , webcams or controllers ) associated with your computer .
#Text=- View a list of technical components on your computer such as USB ports , the CD drive , and speakers .
#Text=- View drivers and running processes on your computer .
#Text=Doing so will open Run , which is a program that allows you to run system commands .
#Text=This command opens your Windows computer 's system information program .
#Text=It 's at the bottom of the Run window .
#Text=Doing so will open the System Information window .
#Text=There are several tabs in the top-left corner of the window that you can use to view different aspects of your system :
#Text=This is the default tab to which System Information opens ; it contains details about your computer 's operating system , installed memory , and processor type .
#Text=- View a list of all hardware drivers and information associated with devices ( e. g. , webcams or controllers ) associated with your computer .
#Text=- View a list of technical components on your computer such as USB ports , the CD drive , and speakers .
#Text=- View drivers and running processes on your computer .
#Text=- Your computer may not have this option ; if it does , you can use this tab to view various pieces of information about your computer 's internet connection .
